lessonsLearned: I need to exercise control and discipline to observe, evaluate, and make just one trade with a target of Rs 5 because I have an obsessive compulsion that compels me to make multiple trades.
recommendations:
Set Clear Objectives: Define your criteria for making a trade clearly. If your target is a profit of Rs 5, make sure you know exactly what conditions need to be met before entering a trade.

Create a Trading Plan: Develop a detailed trading plan that outlines your entry and exit strategies. Stick to this plan and avoid deviating from it. This will help you stay focused on your target.

Use Trading Tools: Utilize tools such as stop-loss orders or limit orders to automate your trades. This can help you avoid making impulsive decisions and stick to your target.

Set a Time Limit: Allocate a specific amount of time each day or week for trading. Once that time is up, stop trading regardless of whether you’ve made a trade or not.

Track Your Trades: Keep a trading journal to record each trade, including the reasons for making it and the outcome. Reviewing this journal regularly can help you identify patterns and improve your discipline.

Accountability: Share your trading goals with a trusted friend or mentor who can help keep you accountable. Regular check-ins can reinforce your commitment to making just one trade.

Mindfulness and Reflection: Practice mindfulness techniques to help manage impulsive behavior. Reflect on your emotions and thoughts before making a trade to ensure that you’re making decisions based on logic rather than compulsion.

Consider Professional Help: If you find that your compulsion is significantly impacting your well-being or financial health, you might want to seek support from a mental health professional who specializes in behavioral issues.
